Thanks Brad for Your input. We'll take a look at the issue You've mentioned and provide a fix in case there's one needed. As for the rest issues, I'd like to park them for now if You don't mind that. So far major review work is still done in the first patch of this series, which will require some effort later during rebasing. Therefore I'd like to hold with remaining fixes until previous patches are fully reviewed.
the order of these needs to be reversed, otherwise we attempt to remove the directory before the share is unmounted.
Acknowledged
Done
it this supposed to be << ?
Acknowledged
Done

When I tried to use this patch, I found that mountPoint was never destroyed and thus the cifs share remains mounted in the filesystem even after the unmount dbus interface is called and the SM transitions back to ready state.  Subsequent attempts to use the slot then fail because the code doesn't expect the cifs share to be mounted already.

I was not able to find any logic anywhere in the active->deactivating->ready transition that destroys mountPoint or target so I suspect this might be a bug.
We will investigate that and provide temporary fix if there's indeed a bug.

Reversing the order of mounter/directory variables turned out to be enough to allow subsequent mounts to be successful but share remained mounted even after unmount - the only thing that called the destructor was next mount, where unique pointer with mounter was being overwritten - added calling .reset() on it manually to unmount the share on unmount
unmount
Acknowledged
Done

Hi @Brad.
Bolesław has pushed some changes that should fix issues You've detected. Please verify them on You side for confirmation.
Hi @Brad, could you let us know if the issues you have discovered have been resolved?
Hi Boleslaw/Michal,  I wound up doing something else - I doubt I'll ever have time to come back and test or review this again, sorry.  Good luck getting your code merged!
